definition[0]: if a business overtrades, it does not have enough WORKING CAPITAL (=available cash) to pay its CREDITORs (=people and organizations it owes money to) and employees
example[0]: Directors of a tour operating company have to give financial guarantees which will be used if the company overtrades and then fails.
definition[1]: if a BROKER overtrades, they buy and sell investments for customers more often than they should, in order to increase the amount of COMMISSION they earn
